alert.note: Alert for Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 1:12AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches possible above 5000 feet...and up to 8 inches above 7000 feet. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are possible as well. * WHERE...Lincoln County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers along an incoming cold front may result in brief snowfall rates exceeding 1 inch per hour, leading to rapid snow accumulations and low visibility. Be prepared for winter travel conditions if traveling on Highway 93 north of Caliente.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
